ENGINEERING TECHNICIAN
Professional Summary
Engineering Technician specializing in quality control sector.
Analytical thinker skilled collecting data and executing product testing procedures with precision and ease.
Results-driven and focused Engineering Technician successful at prioritizing safety, promoting cost-effective solutions and exceeding customer expectations.
Determined Maintenance Worker with skills performing routine operation checks on work equipment and always exercising safety measures to limit injuries.
Hardworking employee with over [2] years of carrying out oral and written instructions effectively and efficiently.
Uses constructive criticism to improve skills and job performance.
Safety-minded Maintenance Worker tasked with troubleshooting, general plumbing and minor electrical work.
Enthusiastic professional promoting excellent attendance record and willing to assist team members in completing assigned tasks.
Organized and dependable candidate successful at managing multiple priorities while maintaining a strong work ethic and exhibiting a positive attitude.
Willingness to take on added responsibilities to meet team goals.
Friendly student available for weekend, evening andholiday shifts.
Considered hardworking, punctual and driven.
To seek and maintain a full-time position that offers professional challenges utilizing interpersonal skills, excellent time management and problem-solving skills.
Dedicated Customer Service professional with knowledge of service delivery and proven multitasking abilities.
Committed to maintaining professional relationships to increase profitability and drive business results.
Customer Service Representative bringing top-notch skills in oral and written communication, active listening and analytical problem-solving skills.
Enhances customer experiences by employing service-oriented behaviors, understanding customer desires and providing customized solutions to build loyalty.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Industrial Equipment Maintenance Technician 2

Location: Erwin, TN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Description/Tasks/Responsibilities

Responsible for supporting operation and maintenance of automated production equipment in a production oriented facility. The Maintenance function includes service, troubleshooting, repair, and installation of all production and facility support equipment. Demonstrates and applies knowledge of mechanical maintenance functions. This includes understanding the materials required for maintaining each equipment area, their general functions for logical scheduling purposes, standard repair procedures, and the significance of accurate and timely processing of work orders within these areas. Troubleshoots with a focus on development of a repair procedure, must be able to identify the needed parts and tools to perform all needed tasks. Must have the ability to communicate these needs in order to facilitate the procurement of the parts. Works with others when problem-solving and repairing or working within their area. Develops knowledge of the maintenance work order system to provide the required information for submittal and closure of work orders. Demonstrates a desire to continuously improve and learn new skills that add value to the business process. Demonstrates the ability to operate, inspect, diagnose and repair vehicles and other mobile equipment. Reports defects and damages to supervision. Tests and makes adjustments to mechanical components and equipment after repairs or assembly to ensure proper performance and compliance with manufacturer specifications and company safety standards. Uses a number of sophisticated tools including electrical, hydraulic and engine testing and diagnostic equipment; welding torches; jacks; hoists and hand tools (e.g., wrenches). Uses computer systems to help diagnose the cause of some problems with heavy equipment. Fuels and lubricates equipment and performs preventive maintenance in accordance with manufacturer specifications. Communicates with the leaders regarding parts and repair orders. Performs scheduled preventive maintenance tasks as assigned. There is no supervision of other workers at this level. Minimizes machine downtime by troubleshooting and resolving mechanical issues. Demonstrates a strong focus by applying the highest level of service to internal customers through work order processing. Must be able to work independently and resolve practical problems. Must complete required training and certification for the Maintenance area in accordance with the Maintenance progression process for a technician. This includes participating in new employee safety training, basic skills training, equipment specific training, material handling equipment, and team building exercises. Performs other duties as assigned. 


Job Requirements/Skills

Basic analytical, problem solving and troubleshooting skills. (Mechanical) Ability to work together with other technicians to diagnose routine and complex issues related to repair/service scheduling, tools required for mechanical repairs, generate potential solutions based on mechanical knowledge and make repairs as required Intermediate verbal and written communication skills Strong interpersonal skills and team player attitude 


Physical/Mental Requirements And Working Conditions

Ability to perform physically demanding work Ability to work in extreme weather conditions and environments wherein there is exposure to noise, dust, grease, smoke, fumes, noxious odors, gases, chemicals and mechanical and electrical hazards Ability to lift up to 50 pounds Ability to perform maintenance duties at elevated heights Ability to stand and walk Ability to effectively communicate; speaking, reading, understanding, writing and hearing clear English; pass audiogram in hearing conservation program as required by location Basic mechanical ability Ability to wear protective equipment such as: goggles, ear plugs, hard hat, gloves, and steel toe boots Ability to read small text, documents, procedures, and instrument readouts; manipulate packages Ability to work near moving mechanical parts and around ionizing radiation Forklift and crane certification 


Minimum Education, Experience And Certification Requirements

Education

High School diploma or GED Vocational training, certification, and/or minimum of three (3) years related experience in basic mechanics 


Certifications

Valid driverâ€™s license or eligible to get a valid state drivers license Mechanic Journeyman certification preferred 


Required Experience

A minimum of 3 years of experience in basic mechanics 


EnergySolutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
